snippet: Harvard’s showing comes after years of poor performance as a series of investment chiefs have come and gone....
abstract: Harvard University reports loss of 2 percent on its endowment investments for year ending June 30, bringing overall value to $35.7 billion; analysts say dip reflects years of poor performance and turnover of investment chiefs; university is seeking replacement for Stephen Blyth, who resigned in May, and appears to be considering N P Narvekar of Columbia University and Amy Falls of Rockefeller University.
lead_paragraph: Harvard’s showing comes after years of poor performance as a series of investment chiefs have come and gone.

headline.main: Harvard, Searching for Endowment Manager, Reports a Loss
